caption.title: Re-plot of Fig 3 where we adapt our sea-level rise estimates to account for future changes in water stored behind dams and in reservoirs.
caption.p: As in Fig 3, panel a is the probability distribution of global mean sea-level rise in 2100 and panel b is the flood survival functions for San Francisco Bay. However, in this figure we adapt our sea-level rise estimates in the year 2100 by adding roughly âˆ¼0.55 m. This increase is roughly comparable to the increase used in Heberger et al. [ 7]. Ultimately, adapting sea-level estimates to this change does not change the main conclusions of this analysis.
